item.title: Ticket #1194 (dropdown_cats doesn't add the correct selected tag) updated
item.dc:creator: crahan
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1194 (dropdown_cats doesn't add the correct selected tag) created
item.dc:creator: crahan
item.description:
The dropdown_cats parameter to mark the current category as selected in the dropdownlist doesn't work. It can be fixed by changing:

if ($category->cat_ID == $selected)

echo ' selected="selected"'; echo '>';

to

if (is_category($category->cat_ID) && $selected)

echo ' selected="selected"'; echo '>';

item.title: Ticket #955 (Let users on same level edit each other) updated
item.dc:creator: TigerDE2
item.description: We've used WP for our school homepage and had this problem (and it was annoying that we couldn't correct each others spelling mistakes), that's why I proposed this option. And, as I said, I'd like it to be an _option_ the admin can set - not necessarily the standard behaviour.

item.title: Ticket #1192 (New Theme Header Field: Status) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Owner, Status changed

item.title: Ticket #1192 (New Theme Header Field: Status) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1192 (New Theme Header Field: Status) created
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Add a "Status:" field to the list of recognized theme header fields. The status can be publish, private, or draft. The default status is publish if none is specified. Theme authors do not include this field in their themes. It is reserved for users to add as needed. This enables users to tell plugins such as the theme switcher to allow switching only between published themes.

item.title: Ticket #1191 (Add query string style API to wp_get_links()) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Owner, Status changed

item.title: Ticket #1191 (Add query string style API to wp_get_links()) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1191 (Add query string style API to wp_get_links()) created
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
wp_get_links() currently accepts a link category id as an argument. Let's extend it to optionally accept a query string API that will interface over get_links(). I'm tired of seeing this in the forums:

get_links(-1, , '< b r / >', , , , , ...) Blah.

Instead:

wp_get_links('show_description=0');

If a category id is given instead of a query string, the old behavior is preserved.

item.title: Ticket #955 (Let users on same level edit each other) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I don't think it's a good idea - authors with same level should be isolated exactly because they are _on_the_same_ level. Otherwise it would be confusing.

For this purposes should be a superiviser created. In other case we would get some sort of unversioned wiki instead of blogs.

item.title: Ticket #1189 (dropdown_pages) updated

Attached patch adds dropdown feature to wp_list_pages(). Usage:

wp_list_pages('style=dropdown');

First draft. Still rough.

item.title: Ticket #1190 (Moderation emails now have blank TO) updated
item.dc:creator: MtDewVirus
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1190 (Moderation emails now have blank TO) created
item.dc:creator: MtDewVirus
item.description:
When the changes for this bug (​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/view.php?id=1168) were commited, this line was removed: $admin_email = get_settings("admin_email");

Now $admin_email is no never set in the function wp_notify_moderator, so the moderation emails are sent into a blackhole.

item.title: Ticket #1175 (Prioritize plugins) updated

item.description: Noted, thank you. The related locale issue is still beyond my grasp.

item.title: Ticket #1175 (Prioritize plugins) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Note that since plugins are loaded in filename sort order, a plugin named 00-high-priority-plugin.php will be loaded before 01-lower-priority-plugin.php which will be loaded before low-priority-plugin.php. This is similar to how SysVInit operates.

item.dc:creator: TechGnome
item.description:
I had a similar problem with the Taft theme. I found that if I opened it up in PSPad and changed the text mode from Mac to DOS (wor Win) and re-saved it, it was OK. I suspect it has to do with the way the different OSs/editors handle CR/LF character(s).

Tg

item.title: Ticket #1170 (Nested blockquotes unallowed?) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1170 (Nested blockquotes unallowed?) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: balanceTags() in its present incarnation will likely never ensure 100% XHTML-ization of posts. In this example, you trip an uncommon(?) situation where a tag is allowed to be immediately nested within itself. balanceTags() already allows for this for [div]. I've attached a patch that also allows it for [blockquote]. Any other situations like this that anyone can think of?

item.title: Ticket #1188 (Sending mails does not work when safe mode activated) updated
item.dc:creator: quidditch
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1188 (Sending mails does not work when safe mode activated) created
item.dc:creator: quidditch
item.description:
If the server use the php safe mode, mails are not sent when a comment is posted even if the option is turned on. It is because in safe mode, you cannot use more than 4 args for a function. I had to erase the $more in this line of the function wp_mail:

return @mail($to, $subject, $message, $headers, $more);

And now it works. What is the use of $more ? Wp_mail does not seem to be documented in the Codex.

in get_archives() @ template-functions-general.php are not used at all

item.title: Ticket #1175 (Prioritize plugins) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: That's nice when you have a hard dependency, but won't help with soft dependencies.

item.title: Ticket #1175 (Prioritize plugins) updated
item.dc:creator: Skeltoac
item.description:
For plugin dependency, I have created a model to defer loading a dependent plugin's core until another plugin has loaded. It differs from setting a priority in that it actually prevents a dependent plugin from loading in case the parent plugin is deactivated. Working example is at ​http://www.skeltoac.com/zip/count-my-clicks.zip. Basic framework:

key-plugin.php <?php Plugin Core $parent_plugin_loaded = true; do_action('parent_plugin_loaded'); ?>

dependent-plugin.php <?php function loadDependentPlugin() {

Plugin Core

} if ($parent_plugin_loaded) loadDependentPlugin(); else add_action('parent_plugin_loaded','loadDependentPlugin'); ?>

edited on: 03-29-05 18:29

item.title: Ticket #1170 (Nested blockquotes unallowed?) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
The problem is in the wpautop() function in functions-formatting.php

The problem can be circumvented by disabling "WordPress should correct invalidly nested XHTML automatically" under "Options > Writing"

Of course a fix would be preferable to avoidance.

item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1182 (RSS2 don't validate) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
The RSS validator reports this error:

pubDate must be an RFC-822 date
